title: Learning Identities and Characters of Studentships. An Alternative to Learning Styles.

references.title: An Analysis of Student Characteristics within the Student Decision Making Process,
references.raw: Moogan, Y. and Baron, S. (2003) An Analysis of Student Characteristics within the Student Decision Making Process, Journal of Further and Higher Education, 27 (3), 271-287.

references.title: Choice, Pathways and Transitions Post-16:
references.raw: Ball, S., Maguire, M. and McCrae, S. (2000) Choice, Pathways and Transitions Post-16: New Youth, New Economies in the Global City. London: Routledge.

references.title: College Life: The Voice of the Learner. London:
references.raw: Bloomer, M. and Hodkinson, P. (1999)  College Life: The Voice of the Learner.  London: FEDA Report.

references.title: Curriculum Making
references.raw: Bloomer, M. (1996)  Curriculum Making in Post-16 Education: The Social Conditions of Studentship. London: Routledge.

references.title: Dropping Out of Further Education: Complex Causes and Simplistic Policy Assumptions,
references.raw: Hodkinson, P. and Bloomer, M. (2001) Dropping Out of Further Education: Complex Causes and Simplistic Policy Assumptions, Research Papers in Education, 16 (2), 117-140.

references.title: Investigating Students’ Perceptions of What Contributes to Productive Seminars and Lectures and Staff Predictions of Students’ Perceptions: how well do staff know their students?
references.raw: Maunder, R. and Harrop, A. (2003) Investigating Students’ Perceptions of What Contributes to Productive Seminars and Lectures and Staff Predictions of Students’ Perceptions: how well do staff know their students? Journal of Further and Higher Education, 27 (4), 443-456.

references.title: Learning identities e-journal of the

references.title: Liquid Love: On the Frailty of Human Bonds.
references.raw: Bauman, Z. (2003) Liquid Love: On the Frailty of Human Bonds. Cambridge: Polity Press.

references.title: Middle Class Struggle? Identity-Work and Leisure among Sixth Formers in the United Kingdom,
references.raw: Kehily, M. and Pattman, R. (2006) Middle Class Struggle? Identity-Work and Leisure among Sixth Formers in the United Kingdom, British Journal of Sociology of Education, 27 (1), 37-52.

references.title: Modernity and the Holocaust.
references.raw: Bauman, Z. (1991) Modernity and the Holocaust. Cambridge: Polity Press.

references.title: Partners in Learning or Monitors for Attendance?
references.raw: Bullock, K. and Fertig, M. (2003) Partners in Learning or Monitors for Attendance? Views on Personal Tutorials from Further Education, Research in Post-Compulsory Education, 8 (3), 329-344.

references.title: Postmodernity and its Discontents.

references.title: Rebels without a Cause. Lewes: Falmer
references.raw: Aggleton, P. (1987) Rebels without a Cause. Lewes: Falmer Press. Ainley, P. and Bailey, B. (1997) The Business of Learning: Staff and Student Experiences of Further Education in the 1990s. London: Cassell.
